title: Program Detail - Find a Program
raw_text:
This website uses resources that are being blocked by your network. Contact your network administrator for more information.
Skip to main content
Find a Program
Program Detail
Business Administration - Foster School of Business - Hybrid MBA
Apply Now >>
Basic Information
Degree Information
Degree Offered:
MASTER OF BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION
CIP Code:
52.0201
Campus: Seattle
Admission Requirements and Contact Information
Application Round Deadlines
Round One: Friday, January 9, 2026
Round Two: Friday, March 6, 2026
Round Three: Friday, May 8, 2026  (space permitting)
Post deadline applications - PRIOR APPROVAL required for applications
after
the Round 3 deadline.  Email Hybrid MBA Admissions for approval by email:
uwhybrid@uw.edu
.  Candidates must clearly meet the application and program attendance requirements.  Applications received without prior approval after the deadline are NOT transferable and cannot be considered for the next academic year. Note: HMBA application portal remaining open after final round deadline does not indicate permission to apply.
Recommendations:
Applicants are strongly advised to request recommendations
before
the application deadline (and may do so prior to submitting the application).
Applications
will not be considered
for admission until
both
required recommendations are received (including current supervisor - see requirements below). If there is a delay in receipt (more than two weeks), the application may be reviewed in a later application round or considered incomplete.
Contact Information
Hybrid MBA Admissions
Program Website
uwhybrid@uw.edu
Requirements and Prerequisites
Applicants should have a complete understanding of the Hybrid MBA program and requirements.  All applicants are STRONGLY encouraged to attend a Hybrid MBA Information Session (hosted weekly – registration link on HMBA website).
Applicants should review the program calendar (located on the HMBA website in the “curriculum” tab and dates listed below) and confirm their ability to attend:
each of the REQUIRED immersions in full (8am first day to 2pm on the last day).
and engage in REQUIRED live synchronous weekly online classes on Tuesdays and / or Wednesday evenings (hosted after 5pm Pacific Time) with camera on.
Unofficial transcripts
demonstrating a 3.0 GPA (or higher) from highest level conferring institution
4-year US accredited baccalaureate degree or accepted equivalent
applicants with less than 3.0 GPA should contact HMBA to determine eligibility prior to submitting application
international degrees should confirm degree eligibility with UW Graduate School and are recommended to apply no later than Round 2 to ensure timely transcript review
if transfer credit (ex community college) grades/courses are not listed on conferring institution transcript, those should also be included.
*If offered admission to the Hybrid MBA program (and accepting offer), you must submit official transcripts to the UW Graduate School via process as outlined in offer.
Recommendations:
Online applicant assessment and required written remarks.
One must be from
current supervisor
(or an HMBA approved alternative).
Second should be from a professional contact
within the last 3 years
.
Academic recommendations are
not
accepted.
Res
ume (1-2 pages) to include but not limited to:
Name and location
LinkedIn profile (please provide as full url, not a hyperlink)
Education including dates of attendance/conferral
Professional experience - chronologically from most recent professional experience including:
-  MONTH and year
-  Identify as Full-time, Part-time, Remote, Internship, Self-employed/side business, and / or Contract
-  Name of company (if contract, please name employer and sponsor company)
-  Job title
-  Location of role – if remote, note region located – ex Remote – Greater Seattle, Remote – Portland)
-  At minimum, list all roles since undergraduate degree achieved.  Addressing significant gaps appreciated.  If non-traditional education journey, please outline experience during and prior to undergraduate program.
-  Brief description of role, responsibilities, and achievements
Education
–
Unofficial transcripts, including conferring and transfer credit institutions
Essays and short answer (please visit our website or application essay section for details regarding essay submission):
REQUIRED:  Personal essay – 5 unique things about you
REQUIRED:  Writing Sample – Difficult professional situation
NOT SUBMITTING EXAM:  If not submitting a GMAT/GRE/EA exam score, applicants are required to provide evidence or description of quantitative and analytical education or ability (providing evidence of academic readiness for our rigorous program)
OPTIONAL:  Additional information essay
Application Fee:
$90 non-refundable application fee
Optional or as applicable:
Additional information essay
Optional admissions exam score (GMAT, GRE or Executive Assessment). We accept expired scores (scores older than 5 years)
Submission of MBA Prep Course completion (ex MBAMath.com) which is strongly encouraged for individuals whose undergraduate program was not Business or graduated 5 or more years ago.
Proof of English Language Proficiency (if your native language is not English) - please visit UW Graduate School website for requirement details
Applicants requiring a student visa are
not
eligible for admission. Please see program website for information.
GRE Requirements
GRE Requirement:
Optional/Not Required
. Submitting GRE scores is not required. However, if official scores are submitted, they may be considered during the review process.
More Information: Hybrid MBA accepts GRE, GMAT, or EA as evidence of academic readiness for our rigorous program. Applicants who can provide evidence of strong quantitative and analytical skills through professional experience or academic coursework are considered without submission of an exam score. Applicants may wish to complete an MBA Prep Course as evidence of academic readiness for the program.
Additional Instructions
Test optional:  The GMAT, GRE, or Executive Assessment is optional, but welcome as evidence of quantitative / analytical skills.
The GMAT Program Code is hMBA 259-75-04.
The GRE Institutional Code is 4854.
Required in-person (Seattle-area) immersion dates for this cohort:
YEAR 1:  September 23-27, 2026;  January 7-10, 2027;  April 1-4, 2027;
YEAR 2:  September 23-26, 2027;  January 6-9, 2028;  March 30 - April 2, 2028;  June 1-5, 2028
Required live, online classes are held Tuesday and / or Wednesday evenings after 5pm Pacific Time.
Optional, recommended review sessions are hosted on Thursday evenings and career management programing is often hosted on Monday evenings or throughout the week. Dates subject to change.
Non-Native English Speaker Information
Graduate School requirement:
English language proficiency (ELP) is required for graduate study at the University of Washington. Therefore, every applicant whose native language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency as outlined in
Graduate School Policy 3.2
.
International Student Information
International students are not eligible to receive an F-1 visa I-20 or the J-1 DS-2019 from the University of Washington for this program. Individuals with US work visas that permit education and will be current through the 2 year program are eligible to apply (please confirm eligibility with the HMBA program
uwhybrid@uw.edu
).
Program Deadlines
Autumn 2026 - Domestic:
Open Date:
11/01/2025
Deadline Date:
07/31/2026
Autumn 2026 - International:
Open Date:
11/01/2025
Deadline Date:
07/31/2026
Application Materials
2 Recommendation(s)
Resume
Menu

extracted_fields.application_requirements: Applicants should have a complete understanding of the Hybrid MBA program and requirements. All applicants are STRONGLY encouraged to attend a Hybrid MBA Information Session. Unofficial transcripts demonstrating a 3.0 GPA (or higher) from highest level conferring institution. 4-year US accredited baccalaureate degree or accepted equivalent. Recommendations: Online applicant assessment and required written remarks. One must be from current supervisor. Second should be from a professional contact within the last 3 years. Resume (1-2 pages). Personal essay – 5 unique things about you. Writing Sample – Difficult professional situation. Proof of English Language Proficiency (if your native language is not English).
extracted_fields.features: Hybrid format with required in-person immersions and live online classes. Optional admissions exam score (GMAT, GRE or Executive Assessment).
